requesting declaratory judgment for non-infringement and invalidity.&#160; The case is in discovery and trial is set
for December&nbsp;6, 2004.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Apple Corps Ltd. v. Apple Computer,
Inc.; Apple Computer, Inc. v. Apple Corps Ltd.</font></i></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Plaintiff,
Apple Corps filed this action on July&nbsp;4, 2003 in the High Court of
Justice, Chancery Division, in London alleging that the Company has breached a
1991 agreement which resolved earlier trademark litigation regarding use of the
Apple marks.&#160; Plaintiff seeks
unspecified damages and other relief.&#160;
The Company filed a motion on October&nbsp;13, 2003, challenging
jurisdiction in the U.K.&#160; On
October&nbsp;8, 2003, the Company filed a case in the United States District
Court for the Northern District of California requesting a declaratory judgment
that the Company has not breached the 1991 agreement.&#160; Apple Corps is challenging jurisdiction in the California
case.&#160; Hearings on both jurisdictional
challenges are set for February&nbsp;2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Articulate Systems,
Inc. v. Apple Computer, Inc.</font></i></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Plaintiff
Articulate filed this action in March&nbsp;1996 in the United States District
Court in Massachusetts claiming patent infringement relating to voice
recognition technology. Plaintiff seeks unspecified damages and other relief.
The Company has answered the complaint, denying all allegations and asserting
numerous affirmative defenses. The Company also asserted counterclaims
requesting declaratory judgment for non-infringement, unenforceability and
invalidity. The case was stayed for several months pending resolution of four
summary judgment motions filed by the Company, all of which were denied by the
Court. Through a series of corporate transactions the assets belonging to
Plaintiff were acquired by a subsidiary, Lernout &amp; Hauspie Speech Products
N.V. (&#147;L&amp;H&#148;). L&amp;H filed for bankruptcy in November&nbsp;2000 and is
being liquidated as part of the bankruptcy. The case has been inactive since
approximately May 2002, pending the resolution of the L&amp;H bankruptcy and
liquidation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Bancroft v. Apple
Computer, Inc.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Plaintiff Bancroft filed this purported class action on
January&nbsp;30, 2002 in Los Angeles County Superior Court on behalf of a
potentially nationwide class of purchasers of certain Power Macintosh G3
computers. Plaintiff alleged violation of the Consumer Legal Remedies Act
(&#147;CLRA&#148;) arising from allegedly poor performance while running the Company&#146;s
Mac OS X operating system, specifically relating to 2D hardware acceleration,
QuickTime movie hardware acceleration, 3D graphics performance and DVD movie
playback. The parties reached a settlement and the Court granted preliminary
approval on September&nbsp;2, 2003 and final approval on January&nbsp;26,
2004.&#160; Settlement of the matter will not
have a material effect on the Company&#146;s financial position or results of
operations.&#160; The Company is currently
administering the settlement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Cagney v. Apple
Computer, Inc.</font></i></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Plaintiff filed this purported class action on
January&nbsp;9, 2004 in Los Angeles County Superior Court, alleging improper
collection of sales tax in transactions involving mail-in rebates.&#160; The complaint alleges violations of</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">42</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='42',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\04-1622-1\task72132\1622-1-ba.htm',USER='sbalaji',CD='Feb  9 17:04 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;">California Civil Code Section&nbsp;17200 (unfair
competition) and seeks unspecified damages and other relief.&#160; The Company was served on January&nbsp;21,
2004 and is beginning its investigation of these allegations.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Craft
v. Apple Computer, Inc. </font></i>(filed December&nbsp;23, 2003, Santa Clara County Superior Court); <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Chin v.
Apple Computer, Inc. </font></i>(filed December&nbsp;23, 2003 in San Mateo
County Superior Court); <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Hughes v. Apple Computer, Inc.</font></i> (filed
December&nbsp;23, 2003 in Santa Clara County Superior Court) <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Westley v.
Apple Computer, Inc. </font></i>(filed December&nbsp;26, 2003 in San Francisco
County Superior Court); <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Keegan v. Apple Computer, Inc. </font></i>(filed
December&nbsp;30, 2003 in Alameda County Superior Court)</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Five separate plaintiffs filed purported class
action cases in various Northern California courts alleging misrepresentations
by the Company relative to iPod battery life.&#160;
The complaints include causes of action for violation of California
Civil Code Section&nbsp;17200 (unfair competition), the Consumer Legal Remedies
Action (&#147;CLRA&#148;) and claims for false advertising, fraudulent concealment and
breach of warranty.&#160; The complaints seek
unspecified damages and other relief.&#160;
The Company is beginning its investigation of these claims.&#160; Plaintiffs have filed a motion to
consolidate these claims in San Mateo County.&#160;
The Company has opposed the motion on the grounds that Santa Clara County
would be the most appropriate venue for consolidation.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Dan, et al. v. Apple
Computer, Inc. et al.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Plaintiffs filed this purported class action on September&nbsp;22, 2003
in Los Angeles County Superior Court against the Company and other members of
the industry on behalf of a nationwide class of purchasers of certain computer
hard drives.&#160; The case alleges
violations of Civil Code Section&nbsp;17200 (&#147;Unfair Competition&#148;), the
Consumer Legal Remedies Act (&#147;CLRA&#148;) and false advertising related to the size
of the drives.&#160; Plaintiffs allege that
calculation of hard drive size using the decimal method misrepresents the
actual size of the drive.&#160; The complaint
seeks unspecified damages and other relief. The Company is beginning its
investigation of these allegations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Davis v. Apple
Computer, Inc.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Plaintiff filed this purported class action in San Francisco County
Superior Court on December&nbsp;5, 2002, alleging that the Company has engaged
in unfair and deceptive business practices relating to its AppleCare Extended
Service and Warranty Plan.&#160; Plaintiff asserts
causes of action for violation of the California Business and Professions Code
&#167;17200 and &#167;17500, breach of the Song-Beverly Warranty Act, intentional
misrepresentation and concealment.&#160;
Plaintiff requests unspecified damages and other relief. The Company
filed a demurrer and motion to strike which were granted, in part, and
Plaintiff filed an amended complaint.&#160;
The Company filed an answer on April&nbsp;17, 2003 denying all
allegations and asserting numerous affirmative defenses.&#160; Plaintiffs subsequently amended their
complaint and the Company expects that they will make further amendments.&#160; On October&nbsp;29, 2003, the Company filed
a motion to disqualify Plaintiff&#146;s counsel in his role as counsel to the
purported class and to the general public.&#160;
The Court granted the motion, but allowed Plaintiff to retain substitute
counsel.&#160; Plaintiff did engage new
counsel for the general public, but not for the class.&#160; The Company moved to disqualify Plaintiff&#146;s
new counsel and to have the Court dismiss the general public claims for
equitable relief.&#160; The Court declined to
disqualify Plaintiff&#146;s new counsel or to dismiss the equitable claims, but did
confirm that the class action claims are dismissed.&#160; The trial date is stayed pending a possible appeal.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Digital Development
Corporation v. Apple Computer, Inc.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Plaintiff, Digital Development Corporation filed this action on
April&nbsp;25, 2003 in the United States District Court in New Jersey, claiming
patent infringement of two patents, 4,975,950 and 5,121,345, related to a
&#147;System and Method of Protecting Integrity of Computer Data and Software.&#148;&#160; Plaintiff requests unspecified damages and
other relief.&#160; The complaint has not yet
been served on the Company.&#160; The Court
dismissed the complaint without prejudice on January&nbsp;12, 2004, but the
Company expects that Plaintiffs will file an amended complaint.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Dowhal v. Apple
Computer, Inc.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Plaintiff filed this representative action in San Francisco County
Superior Court on February&nbsp;4, 2003 alleging that the Company and numerous
other defendants have participated in false advertising and unfair business
practices related to alleged misrepresentation of printer speed.&#160; Plaintiff asserts causes of action for
violation of California Business and Professions Code &#167;17200 and &#167;17500.
Plaintiff requests an injunction, restitution and other unspecified damages and
relief.&#160; The Company filed an answer on
March&nbsp;12, 2003 denying all allegations and asserting numerous affirmative
defenses.&#160; The parties are in discovery.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">43</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='43',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\04-1622-1\task72132\1622-1-ba.htm',USER='sbalaji',CD='Feb  9 17:04 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Dynacore Holdings
Corp. v. Apple Computer, Inc.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Plaintiff Dynacore filed this action on June&nbsp;6, 2001 in United
States District Court for the Southern District of New York against the Company
and thirteen other defendants claiming patent infringement relating to IEEE
1394 technology, also known as FireWire. Plaintiff claims that any computer
system or other electronic product that uses or complies with the IEEE 1394
standard violates the patent. Plaintiff seeks unspecified damages and other
relief. The Company has answered the complaint, denying all allegations and
asserting numerous affirmative defenses. The Company also asserted
counterclaims requesting declaratory judgment for non-infringement and
invalidity. Defendants are seeking to amend the pleading to assert a counterclaim
for inequitable conduct against Dynacore. The case was initially stayed pending
the Federal Circuit&#146;s decision in Datapoint Corp. v. Standard Microsystems
Corp., a related case in which plaintiff claimed that its patent was infringed
by products complying with the fast Ethernet standard. In February&nbsp;2002,
the Federal Circuit affirmed the judgment of non-infringement in Datapoint, and
the District Court lifted the stay in this action. The defendants in this
action filed a joint motion for summary judgment based upon the decision in
Datapoint. The Court granted summary judgment in favor of the defendants on
February&nbsp;11, 2003.&#160; Dynacore
appealed the ruling. The Federal Circuit Court heard argument on January&nbsp;5,
2004.&#160; The parties await a ruling.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">East
Texas Technology Partners LP v. Apple Computer, Inc.</font></i></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Plaintiff filed this patent infringement action
on January&nbsp;23, 2004 in the United States District Court in the Eastern
District of Texas alleging infringement by the Company and seven other
defendants of patent 6,574,239 relating to &#147;virtual connection of a remote unit
to a server.&#148;&#160; Plaintiff seeks
unspecified damages and other relief.&#160;
The Company is investigating this claim.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Hawaii Structural Iron Workers and
Pension Trust Fund v. Apple Computer, Inc. and Steven P. Jobs; Young v. Apple
Computer, Inc. et al; Hsu v. Apple Computer Inc. et al</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Beginning on September&nbsp;27, 2001, three shareholder class action
lawsuits were filed in the United States District Court for the Northern
District of California against the Company and its Chief Executive Officer.
These lawsuits are substantially identical, and purport to bring suit on behalf
of persons who purchased the Company&#146;s publicly traded common stock between
July&nbsp;19, 2000, and September&nbsp;28, 2000. The complaints allege
violations of the 1934 Securities Exchange Act and seek unspecified
compensatory damages and other relief. The Company believes these claims are
without merit and intends to defend them vigorously. The Company filed a motion
to dismiss on June&nbsp;4, 2002, which was heard by the Court on
September&nbsp;13, 2002. On December&nbsp;11, 2002, the Court granted the
Company&#146;s motion to dismiss for failure to state a cause of action, with leave
to Plaintiffs to amend their complaint within thirty days. Plaintiffs filed
their amended complaint on January&nbsp;31, 2003, and on March&nbsp;17, 2003,
the Company filed a motion to dismiss the amended complaint. The Court heard
the Company&#146;s motion on July&nbsp;11, 2003 and dismissed Plaintiff&#146;s claims
with prejudice on August&nbsp;12, 2003.&#160;
Plaintiffs have appealed the ruling.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">MacTech v. Apple Computer, Inc.;
Macadam v. Apple Computer, Inc.; Computer International, Inc. v. Apple
Computer, Inc.; Elite Computers and Software, Inc. v. Apple Computer, Inc.; The
Neighborhood Computer Store v. Apple Computer, Inc.</font></i> (All in
Santa Clara County Superior Court).</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Five resellers have filed similar lawsuits against the Company for
various causes of action including breach of contract, fraud, negligent and
intentional interference with economic relationship, negligent
misrepresentation, trade libel, unfair competition and false advertising.
Plaintiffs request unspecified damages and other relief.&#160;&#160; The Company answered the Computer
International complaint on November&nbsp;12, 2003 denying all allegations and
asserting numerous affirmative defenses.&#160;
The Company expects the other four plaintiffs to file amended
complaints.&#160; On October&nbsp;1, 2003,
one of the resellers, Macadam was deauthorized as an Apple reseller. Macadam
filed a motion for a temporary order to reinstate it as a reseller, which the
Court denied.&#160; The Court denied
Macadam&#146;s motion for a preliminary injunction on December&nbsp;19, 2003. The
parties are in discovery.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Palmieri v. Apple
Computer, Inc.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Plaintiff filed this purported class action on September&nbsp;5, 2003
in Los Angeles County Superior Court on behalf of a nationwide class of
purchasers of certain PowerBooks.&#160; The
case alleges violations of Civil Code Section&nbsp;17200 (Unfair Competition)
and the Consumer Legal Remedies Act (&#147;CLRA&#148;) arising from an alleged design defect
in the PowerBooks which purportedly causes marks and dead pixels in the LCD
screens.&#160; Plaintiffs amended their
complaint to allege an additional defect in the new 15&#148; PowerBook, introduced
in September&nbsp;2003, which purportedly causes &#147;white spots&#148; on the
screen.&#160; The complaint seeks unspecified
damages and other relief.&#160; The Company
filed an answer on January&nbsp;8, 2004 denying all allegations and asserting
numerous affirmative defenses.&#160; The
Company is investigating these allegations.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">44</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='44',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\04-1622-1\task72132\1622-1-ba.htm',USER='sbalaji',CD='Feb  9 17:04 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">TIBCO Software, Inc.
v. Apple Computer, Inc.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Plaintiff filed this case on August&nbsp;27, 2003 in United States
District Court for the Northern District of California alleging trademark
infringement by the Company for using the mark &#147;Rendezvous.&#148; Plaintiff&#146;s mark
is &#147;TIBCO Rendezvous.&#148;&#160; The complaint
seeks unspecified damages and other relief.&#160;
The Company answered the complaint denying all allegations and asserting
numerous affirmative defenses.&#160; The
Company also asserted counterclaims requesting a declaratory judgment for
non-infringement, invalidity and no dilution.&#160;
The case is in discovery.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">UNOVA, Inc. v. Apple
Computer, Inc., et al.</font></i></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Plaintiff
UNOVA filed this patent infringement action against the Company and six other
defendants on May 8, 2002 in the Central District of California for
infringement of eight UNOVA patents related to &#147;Smart Battery Management.&#148;
Plaintiff alleges that the Company&#146;s portable computers manufactured since 1996
infringe these eight patents. Plaintiff has filed similar lawsuits against
other companies in addition to the co-defendants in this case. Plaintiff seeks
unspecified damages and other relief. The Company has answered the complaint,
denying all allegations and asserting numerous affirmative defenses. The
Company also asserted counterclaims requesting a declaratory judgment for
non-infringement, invalidity and unenforceability.&#160; The parties have reached a settlement. Settlement of the matter
did not have a material effect on the Company&#146;s financial position or results
of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-style:italic;font-weight:normal;margin:6.0pt 0in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Palatino" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;">Item 4. Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders</font></i></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">No matters were submitted to a vote of security holders during the
Company&#146;s first fiscal quarter ended December&nbsp;27, 2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 6. Exhibits and Reports on Form 8-K</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&nbsp;<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">Index to Exhibits</font></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

 <tr>

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.16%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10-Q</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.34%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5/13/03</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">

  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.5%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="7%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:7.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.94%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="52%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:52.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rule13a-15(e) / 15d-15(e) Certification of Chief Executive Officer</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.34%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.16%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.34%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.52%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:6.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-family:Wingdings;font-size:10.0pt;">&#253;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.5%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="7%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:7.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31.2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.94%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="52%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:52.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rule13a-15(e) / 15d-15(e) Certification of Chief Financial Officer</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.34%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.16%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.34%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.52%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:6.66%;">

  <td width="7%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:7.5%;">

  <td width="52%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:52.3%;">

  Financial Officer</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.34%;">

  <td width="6%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:6.66%;">

  <td width="1%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.5%;">

  </td>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(b) Reports on Form
8-K</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company filed a current report on Form 8-K on January&nbsp;14,
2004, to reference and furnish as exhibits a press release and data sheet
issued to the public by the Company on January&nbsp;14, 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company filed a current report on Form 8-K on October&nbsp;15,
2003, to reference and furnish as exhibits a press release and data sheet
issued to the public by the Company on October&nbsp;15, 2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<html>

<head>



</head>

<body link="blue" vlink="purple">

<div style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Exhibit
31.1</font></b></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CERTIFICATION
OF CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I, Steven P. Jobs, certify that:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I have reviewed this quarterly report on
Form 10-Q of Apple Computer, Inc.;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based on my knowledge, this quarterly
report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to
state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with
respect to the period covered by this report;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based on my knowledge, the financial
statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly
present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations
and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this
report;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The registrant&#146;s other certifying
officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure
controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and
15d-15(e)) for the registrant and have:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Designed such disclosure controls and
procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed
under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the
registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by
others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this
report is being prepared;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Evaluated the effectiveness of the
registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report
our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such
evaluation; and</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Disclosed in this report any change in
the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during
the registrant&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal
quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is
reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control over
financial reporting; and</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The registrant&#146;s other certifying
officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of
internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s auditors and the
audit committee of registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the
equivalent functions):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All significant deficiencies and material
weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial
reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#146;s
ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Any fraud, whether or not material, that
involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the
registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  <td width="52%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:52.78%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">February&nbsp;9, 2004</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="47%" colspan="3" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:47.22%;">

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="47%" colspan="3" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:47.22%;">
  <p style="font-size:12.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="52%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:52.78%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="5%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:5.9%;">

  </td>
  <td width="28%" valign="top" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:28.1%;">

  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.22%;">

<head>



</head>

<body link="blue" vlink="purple">

<div style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Exhibit 31.2</font></b></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CERTIFICATION OF CHIEF FINANCIAL
OFFICER</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I, Fred D. Anderson, certify that:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I have reviewed this quarterly report on
Form 10-Q of Apple Computer, Inc.;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based on my knowledge, this quarterly
report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to
state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with
respect to the period covered by this report;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based on my knowledge, the financial
statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly
present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations
and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this
report;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The registrant&#146;s other certifying
officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure
controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and
15d-15(e)) for the registrant and have:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Designed such disclosure controls and
procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed
under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the
registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by
others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this
report is being prepared;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Evaluated the effectiveness of the
registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report
our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such
evaluation; and</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Disclosed in this report any change in
the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during
the registrant&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal
quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is
reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control over
financial reporting; and</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The registrant&#146;s other certifying
officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of
internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s auditors and the
audit committee of registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the
equivalent functions):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All significant deficiencies and material
weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial
reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#146;s
ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Any fraud, whether or not material, that
involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the
registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="52%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:52.78%;">

  </td>

  <td width="52%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:52.78%;">

  </td>
  <td width="47%" colspan="3" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:47.22%;">
  <p style="font-size:12.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="52%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:52.78%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="5%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:5.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">By:</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="28%" valign="top" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:28.1%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">/s/ Fred D. Anderson</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.22%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="52%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:52.78%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="5%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:5.9%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="41%" colspan="2" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:41.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fred D. Anderson</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="52%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:52.78%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="5%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:5.9%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="41%" colspan="2" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:41.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Executive Vice President and<br>
  Chief Financial Officer</font></p>
  </td>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-32.1
<SEQUENCE>5
<FILENAME>a04-1622_1ex32d1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-32.1
<TEXT>
<html>

<head>



</head>

<body link="blue" vlink="purple">

<div style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">

<p align="right" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Exhibit
32.1</font></b></p>

<p align="right" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">CERTIFICATION OF CHIEF
EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER<br>
PURSUANT TO<br>
18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350,<br>
AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO<br>
SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I, Steven P. Jobs, certify,
pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the
Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that the Quarterly Report of Apple Computer, Inc.
on Form 10-Q for the period ended December 27, 2003 fully complies with the
requirements of Section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934
and that information contained in such Form 10-Q fairly presents in all
material respects the financial condition and results of operations of Apple
Computer, Inc.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I, Fred D. Anderson, certify,
pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the
Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that the Quarterly Report of Apple Computer, Inc.
on Form 10-Q for the period ended December 27, 2003 fully complies with the
requirements of Section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934
and that information contained in such Form 10-Q fairly presents in all
material respects the financial condition and results of operations of Apple
Computer, Inc.</font></p>
